daily_fact: Stay engaged with your community through local news and civic participation.
topline_md: Recent updates in New York City include a subway stabbing labeled as a hate crime, a cold front affecting weather, a partial building collapse in the Bronx, and significant developments in local governance, including Mayor Mamdani's plans for transportation and housing amidst federal funding cuts for sanctuary cities.

risks_alerts.title: Risks & Alerts
risks_alerts.summary_md:

- Subway stabbing reported on Lex Avenue Line; incident classified as a Jewish hate crime. civics_politics.title: Civics & Politics
civics_politics.summary_md:
### Civics & Politics

- President Trump announces federal funding cuts for sanctuary cities starting Feb. 1; Mayor Mamdani vows to defend NYC. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC nurse strike sees thousands of union hospital workers picketing across the city. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NY attorney general joins NYC's fight to block the sale of 5,000 rent-stabilized apartments.
